justification: Study 2 notes: “to more directly examine any association between demand and prior results, we also included the Social Desirability Scale (Fischer and Fick, 1993).”
The Supplementary Materials state that the self-regulation measures "included the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale (BIS)…"
The article lists the self-regulation battery as including “the Difficulty with Emotion Regulation Scale (DERS).”
The Supplementary section specifies the inclusion of “the Considerations of Future Consequences Scale (CFC).”
The authors report administering “the Domain Specific Risk-Taking Scale (DOSPERT)” as part of their individual-difference battery.
The paper notes that the measures “included … the Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI).”
Among the listed instruments is “the Three-Factor Eating Questionnaire (TFEQ).”
The supplementary materials mention collecting “indications of … academic (AES)… self-efficacy.”
The same list refers to assessments of “general self-efficacy (GES).”
